intro: Thymelaea virgata subsp. broussonetii, commonly known as the Broussonet's thymelaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
